framework_metadata.title: Valor RM Report Framework
framework_metadata.description: Comprehensive relationship management analysis framework with detailed engagement strategies and tactical guidance

executive_summary.engagement_objective: Client's primary goal for the engagement

depth_analysis.description: Interaction depth based on Levels of Self model

orientation.description: How to present proposal as solution to goals
orientation.recent_improvements: Updates target may not be aware of

receive_resistance.description: Listen to all resistance points completely

golden_ally.description: Near-perfect alignment, full trust, mutual interest, and influence — act boldly.

prime_partner.description: Strong rapport, shared goals, and advantageous leverage — move assertively.

strategic_friend.description: Trust and interest align well; engagement is likely to yield strong returns.

reliable_backer.description: Mostly aligned and cooperative — useful for support or joint efforts.

favorable_contact.description: Generally warm and interested — good timing for collaborative outreach.

open_opportunity.description: Neutral-to-positive stance — positive engagement likely with right approach.

willing_associate.description: Some alignment and soft rapport — viable with modest effort.

cautious_ally.description: Engagement is possible but requires rapport-building or value show.

mixed_potential.description: Uneven footing — carefully assess intent and influence before advancing.

uncertain_ground.description: Weak alignment, but no hostility — possible to influence with caution.

neutral_zone.description: Neither for nor against — engagement impact will depend on context.

disinterested.description: Low engagement energy — indifferent or unmotivated relationship.

cool_distance.description: Little warmth or alignment — minimal engagement return expected.

soft_resistance.description: Subtle friction or low buy-in — may slow or block progress passively.

guarded_adversary.description: Resistant and skeptical — likely to resist influence or oppose softly.

opposed_actor.description: Active disinterest or mild hostility — engagement is risky.

tactical_threat.description: Opposes your intent with some leverage — may need containment.

strategic_obstacle.description: Likely to undermine or block your efforts — manage or isolate.

influential_enemy.description: Active, resourced opposition — avoid engagement or disarm diplomatically.

hostile_force.description: High risk, high resistance — engagement invites harm or sabotage.

total_adversary.description: Complete misalignment — hostile, powerful, and oppositional. Avoid.

confidant.description: You trust them fully, share openly, and the bond is both personal and enduring.

friend.description: Engaging, familiar, and positive—there's enough interaction to maintain warmth.

friendly_face.description: Someone who brings a smile—a casual, recurring presence you're glad to see.

close_ally.description: A trusted supporter with shared goals and mutual respect—solid even without constant contact.

supporter.description: Generally encouraging and cooperative; the connection is pleasant, even if occasional.

lighthearted_familiar.description: Brief, upbeat encounters that brighten your day without going deeper.

trusted_contact.description: Not often around, but you'd reach out without hesitation and expect goodwill in return.

warm_acquaintance.description: Sporadic interactions that leave a good impression and a sense of openness.

positive_recognition.description: You both know of each other, and it's good vibes even if you've barely spoken.

peer.description: Someone you know well and interact with often, but the relationship stays balanced and professional.

colleague.description: Frequently engaged in shared tasks, but the connection doesn't extend beyond function.

regular_face.description: Someone you see often in passing—nods, glances, maybe names, but not much else.

associate.description: A known collaborator with a clear role—neither warm nor cold, just dependable.

workmate.description: You interact enough to recognize patterns, but there's no personal investment.

familiar_bystander.description: A name or face you've encountered a few times, without meaning or momentum.

passive_familiar.description: History exists, but mutual indifference has settled in over time.

surface_contact.description: Occasionally involved and easily forgotten—just part of the background.

unknown_quantity.description: You know of them, but neither of you have made an impression.

tense_recognition.description: You recognize them and they you, but the vibe is unmistakably off.

cold_associate.description: You know them, you don't like them, and there's no effort to change that.

grudge_holder.description: A relationship marked by old wounds and long silences, but the negativity remains sharp.

bitter_familiar.description: A weak tie soured by snubs, slights, or old impressions that never improved.

frictional_peer.description: Someone you work around, not with—interactions are uneasy, and tension is routine.

adversary.description: A recurring opponent shaped by history, ideology, or repeated friction.

irritant.description: Present often but only ever on your nerves—minor interactions leave lasting frustration.

antagonist.description: Frequently opposed but without emotional depth—this is a known blocker or saboteur.

nemesis.description: Someone you know intimately and oppose completely—every encounter is charged with personal conflict.

offensive_persuasion.goal: Prepare persuasive arguments to convince them that your request will further their own goals
offensive_persuasion.cost: Prepare persuasive arguments to convince them that your request will not cost them as much as they believe
offensive_persuasion.confused: Prepare persuasive arguments to make them realize they should desire your request

defensive_persuasion.goal: Prepare persuasive arguments to convince them that their request will be detrimental to their own goals
defensive_persuasion.cost: Prepare persuasive arguments to convince them that their request will cost them much more than they thought
defensive_persuasion.confused: Prepare persuasive arguments to make them realize they should not desire their request

offensive.high_respect: Prepare manipulations to show how they would lose standing with you for refusing your request
offensive.high_harm: Prepare manipulations to show how you could damage their goals if they refuse your request
offensive.high_aid: Prepare manipulations to show how you could benefit their goals if they accept your request

defensive.high_respect: Prepare manipulations to show how they would lose standing with you for pursuing their request
defensive.high_harm: Prepare manipulations to show how you could damage their goals if they pursue their request
defensive.high_aid: Prepare manipulations to show how you could benefit their goals if they drop their request
